alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Mason; Robertson (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 4:14PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN MASON, ROBERTSON AND SOUTH CENTRAL BRACKEN COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 10 miles south of Brooksville, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Olivet, Sardis, US Route 62 at State Route 875, Abigail, Milford, Burika, Alhambra, Mitchells Mill, Santa Fe, Peed, Lowell, Petra, US Route 62 at State Route 616, Hittville, Piqua and Mays Lick. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
